data.title: Great location for Italian food
data.text: I was there for happy hour. The prices were reasonable. The food was authentic Italian. The service is great. I will return to this restaurant to try another dish.

data.title: Classy Restaurant
data.text:
The outlook inside the restaurant was nice. Looks like a high end restaurant. Food was pretty good. I liked the Raviolo Di Patate Dolci Giapponesi Al Gorgonzola as the taste was unique. 
Chocolate soufflé was quite a disappointment because the taste and textures was more like chocolate lava cake instead.

data.title: Good food, nice atmosphere
data.text: Try the calamari,  best I've ever had.  They have daily specials, and a lunch and separate dinner menu.  The wait staff was friendly and very attentive.

data.title: Italian
data.text: I have eaten here twice. The first time, I had spaghetti and meatballs and the second time, I had an angus burger. The spaghetti was standard but a good sized luncheon portion. The burger was very juicy and flavorful. I liked their freshly baked bread that is served before the meal.  I wanted to try the tiramisu, but a portion was $8, which was more than I wanted to pay, so I saved the calories. I will eat here again.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: We wanted to try this restaurant after getting a recommendation from a friend. We are from New Jersey and were in queen creek visiting. We went there on a thursday night and entered and greeted friendly by hostess. We were seated at a table by the pizza oven. We immediately asked server why it was so hot in the restaurant. After asking three times at least to lower air we gave up. I could barely eat I was so hot.  My friend asked to speak to owner to say hello and he refused twice stating he was busy. Our table was a clear shot into kitchen & he was not busy. Customer service is important. Food average.

data.title: Awesome venue group biz dinner!
data.text: We were situated at nice long table for large business dinner. Nice service and really like the ink squid (black) pasta.

data.title: Lovely for special occasion dinner
data.text: Our family of 8 gathered at La Stalla for a birthday dinner. Excellent service from Martha and other team members. She went out of her way to watch over us and make sure we had everything we needed. The food was high quality....loved the appetizers and main dish of salmon pasta. Thank you!

data.title: Try the Special
data.text:
I have eaten here dozens of times.  Service has always been good and I like the room a lot.  I can't say anything bad about the presentation or delivery of the food in any way.

The menu has a nice variety so if I'm in the mood for something, I know it will be executed flawlessly.  There isn't anything on there that I would eat multiple times a week or can't live without.

The menu doesn't knock my socks off, but the specials are usually incredible.  We eat there enough that we recognize some of the regular ones that are in the rotation.  Sometimes, I actually just want to call and ask what the specials are before I decide to come.  So, if you go and you are debating between something on the menu and a special that seems a little riskier, take the risk.

If you don't overdo it with wine and dessert, you can keep the cost reasonable.  It's not cheap, but you always get what you pay for.

data.title: Great little Italian Restaurant
data.text: The food and service was amazing! definitely a plan to go back there. Food was great (and I tried a little of everything on my husband's plate as well!) and the service was wonderful!

data.title: Passed the Carbonara test
data.text:
Most places I've tried eating Carbonara outside of Italy have failed miserably. This is one of the best ways of figuring out whether the restaurant is genuine Italian or they haven't even tasted proper Italian.
The food was amazing, pretty much like eating at an Italian trattoria. The atmosphere of the place was lovely and the service good so that's the first place I'll stop to eat when I'm back in Phoenix.

data.title: went to this restaurant while on vacation
data.text: very fancy restaurant , food was great, waiter was very good ,pricey , but worth it for special occasions, i would highly recommend it

data.title: Good but not great
data.text:
Hubby and I recently had an early dinner at La Stalla and had mixed feelings about our meal.  We liked the atmosphere, and our server was very good. The food was mixed.

We each started with a glass of the house Pinot Noir, Block 9.   We eventually ordered a third glass of wine to split as we finished our meal.

The wine was good and I give La Stalla a big thumbs up for having sparkling clean wine glasses.  I can't stand glasses that  have water spots and streaks, or worse yet remnants of another diner's lipstick.  And so many "nice" restaurants don't go the extra mile to wipe down their glasses to ensure a sparkling glass.

The meal started out with some warm, crusty and delicious Tuscan bread.  Bread was accompanied by a serving of grated Parmesan and a side of Balsamic vinaigrette.   Olive oil is on every table.  Bread was yummy!

Hubby had the Caesar salad and especially liked the dressing, very light and not creamy.  I had the pear and Gorgonzola salad and was surprised to see that the pear was from a can.  The salad was very tasty, with plenty of cheese and nuts, but the canned pear was a disappointment.

I had the dinner special of Osso Bucco which was delicious and fall off the bone tender.  It was served on fettuccine which was nothing special.

Hubby had the pasta with broccoli and sweet Italian sausage in a creamy garlic sauce.   The sausage was not served the way we expected it.  Usually we'd see sausage cut in bite size pieces or even larger chunks to be cut by diner. This sausage was in tiny little balls.  Still tasty but unexpected and not terribly visually appealing.

With the 3 glasses of wine, 2 salads, and 2 entrees our check came to $102.00 - before tip.  For the most part we enjoyed our experience but were disappointed in a couple of things, this the 3 star rating.

data.title: Excellent food and Service
data.text: We came for a family dinner and had a young child with us. The waiter made sure that she had some spashetti and a drink while the adults were talking and taking their time to order and have drinks. The food was excellent, and fresh. The veal shank was the special and was superb. The waiter was very attentive even though the restaurant was very busy. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Great Authentic Italian
data.text:
I am not in AZ much bit have been here 3 times in 3 years. Always a great meal. Always an authentic experience. This is not a "red sauce" italian place.... It's the real deal. 
Always an exceptional experience.

data.title: Service
data.text: We sat for at least 20 min, before anyone approached us.   Another 5 before she came back to take orders.    Took drink & food orders at same time.   Took almost an hr  to come  with drinks.    Took 2 hrs to get our food!  Unacceptable!    Food was good, but would we go back?    Don't think so.  There were 8 of us.  Had to ask for bread.  It was a Wed. night.   They were busy but that doesn't excuse the poor service.   Where was the Manager, he should have been on the floor helping,

data.title: Authentic Italian Cuisine
data.text: Paulo is an excellent chef. Food is delicious. Wine list is amazing. Be sure to ask for the special wine list if you want to impress your friends.

data.title: Very nice!
data.text: Interesting and varied menu...margharita pizza to braised rabbit on the evening menu...excellent thin crust pizza (enough for two with salad).  Large selection of wines.  Our waiter Ian was very gracious and efficient.

data.title: Popular with locals -a good sign
data.text: We didn't have reservations but were seated at the bar.  The staff are pleasant and prompt and the menu was ample, as were the portions.  I had chicken with lemon and capers, my husband had Veal Saltimbocca.  The bread has a nice hard crust and the vegetables were al dente.  My chicken was good but I felt that in May have been partially cooked before finishing.  My husband was pleased with his choice.  We didn't order it but the pizza looked terrific.  Prices are reasonable ( $18. For mine and $ 25. for my husbands.  Why a 4 rating ? I reserve the 5 for extraordinary.

data.title: A perfect anniversary
data.text:
This was surprising.  I will say that it was more like 4.75, but why be picky..

Food - we had calamari,  mussels, and bruschetta.  The calamari was perfect..soft, not crispy, large. It was delcious. The mussels were good.basic, but good. The bruschetta was baked and topped with mushrooms. DELICIOUS! For dinner I had veal saltimbocca which was fantastic. My wife had spaghetti carbonara which was perfect. For dessert, creme Brule and Gelato. 

Service - top notch.  She knew her wines, had a great personality, and was efficient. That's why we tipped 40%.

Atmosphere- very intimate. There was three large parties but it was still cozy.

Great place.

data.title: Debated a 3 or 4 Rating - Read why I went with a 3
data.text:
I guess I would give this restaurant a 3+. It was good, but I found it did not meet my expectations after reading many very good reviews. I would say that my reservations are based on personal preferences, so don't be turned off.

The atmosphere is attractive and clean. However, the straight-backed wood chairs are not comfortable for any length of time.

We ordered the Fried Calamari appetizer. The calamari was cooked perfectly, but we would have enjoyed it more if the coating had been crispy. The serving was more than large enough for 2 people. I think 4 could share it.

I splurged on Spaghetti Carbonara. It was tasty, but (again a personal preference) the proscuitto should have had more of the fat rendered out of it. The pieces were generous, but I didn't eat most of them because they were unpleasantly chewy.

My husband had the Sweet Potato Ravioli in Gorgonzola Sauce. Very, very, rich. The ravioli filling seemes a little overly sweet. The gorgonzola sauce was good, but perhaps overloaded with butter.

Service was young, casual, and friendly - in a good way.

We wouldn't go out of our way to dine here again, but we might try again (selecting different menu items).
